title: FTSE LIVE: Pound surges as Brexit deal is done; WHSmith snaps up rival
text:
The pound leapt today against as it was revealed that the UK and EU had agreed on a Brexit deal.

Sterling rose strongly against the US dollar and euro, but optimism is being tempered by the DUP's refusal to back the agreement - setting the stage for a knife-edge vote in the House of Commons on Saturday.

Elsewhere, WHSmith's fast growing travel arm is about to get another boost as the group revealed plans to snap up US travel rival Marshall Retail Group for £312million. The deal comes a year after WHSmith bought travel retailer InMotion for £155million.

David Wild, outgoing boss Domino's Pizza, said today that the chain's international business 'remains disappointing' so the board has decided to exit the markets.
description: The pound leapt today against as it was revealed that the UK and EU had agreed on a Brexit deal. but optimism is being tempered by the DUP's refusal to back the agreement.
authors: Emily Hardy For This Is Money
